title: gcc@7.3.0:9.2.0 fail to build on Arch Linux
body:
I tried to build older gcc versions on my workstation, but all versions, except the gcc@develop version, fail with the following errors. The issue is similar to [issue 15229](https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/15229), but this one here fails with a different error.

### Spack version
<!-- Add the output to the command below -->
```console
$ spack --version
0.14.0-110-b472c1380
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install -v gcc@8.3.0

# As well as:
$ spack install -v gcc@8.3.0+binutils
```
Same also applies for  gcc@7.3.0, gcc@9.1.0, gcc@9.2.0.
gcc@develop builds fine!

### Platform and user environment

<!-- Please report your OS here:  -->
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux mathsen 5.5.7-arch1-1 #1 SMP PREEMPT Sat, 29 Feb 2020 19:06:02 +0000 x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ cat /etc/os-release
Name="Arch Linux"
``` 

```commandline
$ spack config get compilers
compilers:
- compiler:
    spec: clang@9.0.1
    paths:
      cc: /usr/bin/clang
      cxx: /usr/bin/clang++
      f77:
      fc:
    flags: {}
    operating_system: arch
    target: x86_64
    modules: []
    environment:
      unset: []
    extra_rpaths: []
- compiler:
    spec: gcc@9.2.1
    paths:
      cc: /usr/bin/gcc
      cxx: /usr/bin/g++
      f77: /usr/bin/gfortran
      fc: /usr/bin/gfortran
    flags: {}
    operating_system: arch
    target: x86_64
    modules: []
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []

```
